queryName: There are non GCP-managed service account keys for a service account
descriptionText: Ensures that only GCP-managed service account keys are used, preventing manually created keys that pose security risks.
detailedDescriptionText: User-managed service account keys in GCP present significant security risks because they are long-lived credentials that can exist outside of Google Cloud's security boundary. These keys are frequently mishandled - embedded in code, stored in insecure locations, or shared among developers - creating multiple avenues for credential compromise and unauthorized access. Organizations should avoid creating user-managed service account keys whenever possible, instead using more secure authentication methods like workload identity federation, impersonation, or short-lived OAuth tokens managed by Google to maintain proper security controls.
